titleStmt.title: University of Louisville School of Law

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: University of Louisville School of Law

body.p: Department of legal education at the University of Louisville. Operated in Louisville, Kentucky, from 1846 by an act of the Kentucky Legislature, which combined the Louisville Medical Institute and Louisville College. Dean(s): Henry Pirtle (1846-1873).

ab.bibl:
Dwayne D. Cox and William J. Morison, "The Emergence of a University," in The University of Louisville, (Lexington, Kentucky: University Press of Kentucky, 2000), accessed August 10, 2021, p. 23-24.
"Our History and Traditions," Louis D. Brandeis School of Law, University of Louisville, accessed August 10, 2021, https://louisville.edu/law/about/history-and-traditions.
